info.description: Use the REST API for Oracle SOA Cloud Service on Oracle Public Cloud Machine to manage, monitor, and perform operations on SOA services and servers. To manage Oracle Managed File Transfer on Oracle Public Cloud Machine, see the REST API for Oracle Managed File Transfer on Oracle Public Cloud Machine.
info.title: REST API for Oracle SOA Cloud Service on Oracle Public Cloud Machine
info.x-summary: Use the REST API for Oracle SOA Cloud Service on Oracle Public Cloud Machine to manage, monitor, and perform operations on SOA services and servers.

tags.name: Manage Restore Operations
tags.description: Restore a service instance, list restore operations, and retrieve the details of a restore operation.

tags.name: Manage Servers
tags.description: View, add, and remove managed servers. Retrieve server operations and status. View clusters and their servers.

tags.name: Manage Service Backups
tags.description: Retrieve, create, archive, delete, or list service backups.

tags.name: Manage the Backup Configuration
tags.description: View and update the backup configuration.

tags.name: Provision Services
tags.description: Retrieve provisioned instances and provision new instances.

tags.name: Scaling
tags.description: Scaling Up or Scaling Down an instance

tags.name: View Service Provisioning Status
tags.description: View the provisioning status of a service.

post.description: Adds a new managed server to the specified cluster. Scales the service by factor of one node.

parameters.description: Name of the cluster.

parameters.description: If set to true, creates a cluster with the specified name if it does not exist.

parameters.description: Name of the server.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Forces the server removal if set to true.

put.description:
Scales the specified Administration Server or Managed Server node to change its compute shape or add block storage.

You can scale only the Administration Server node and Managed Server nodes in a WebLogic Server cluster. Oracle SOA Cloud Service does not support scaling for other nodes in a service instance, such as the load balancer node or capacity unit nodes in the Coherence data tier.

You can add block storage to a new volume or one of the following existing volumes:

  • Backup storage volume (Administration Server node only)
  • Domain home storage volume
  • Oracle Fusion Middleware home storage volume

You cannot remove block storage from a storage volume.

Note: Scaling is not supported by Oracle SOA Cloud Service - Virtual Image instances.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Name of the node (Administration Server or Managed Server) for which you want to increase block storage capacity.

parameters.name: identityId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle SOA Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Name of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the create instance request. Bold indicates a required value.

version.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd.

Oracle WebLogic Server software version. Valid values include: 12.1.3.0.4 and 10.3.6.0.9.

managedServerCount.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only.

Number of managed servers. Allowed values are 1, 2, or 4.

adminUserName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only.

Username for the WebLogic Server administrator. The name must be between 8 and 128 characters long and cannot contain any of the following characters:

  • Tab
  • Brackets
  • Parentheses
  • The following special characters: left angle bracket (<), right angle bracket (>), ampersand (&), pound sign (#), pipe symbol (|), and question mark (?).

adminPassword.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only.

Password for WebLogic Server administrator. The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Starts with a letter
  • Is between 8 and 30 characters long
  • Contains letters, at least one number, and optionally, any number of these special characters: dollar sign ($), pound sign (#), and underscore (_).

otdAdminUserName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only.

Username for the Oracle Traffic Director administrator. The name must be between 8 and 128 characters long and cannot contain any of the following characters:

  • Tab
  • Brackets
  • Parentheses
  • The following special characters: left angle bracket (<), right angle bracket (>), ampersand (&), pound sign (#), pipe symbol (|), and question mark (?).

This value defaults to the WebLogic Server administrator username, if not specified.

otdAdminPassword.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only.

Password for Oracle Traffic Director administrator. The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Starts with a letter
  • Is between 8 and 30 characters long
  • Contains letters, at least one number, and optionally, any number of these special characters: dollar sign ($), pound sign (#), and underscore (_).

This value defaults to the WebLogic Server administrator password, if not specified.

connectString.description:
The string used to connect to the database.

The connection string must be entered using one of the following formats:

  • host:port/SID
  • host:port/serviceName

dbaName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only.

Username for the Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instance administrator.

For service instances based on Oracle WebLogic Server 11g (10.3.6), this value must be set to a database user with DBA role. You can use the default user SYSTEM or a user that has been granted the DBA role.

For service instances based on Oracle WebLogic Server 12c (12.1.3), this value must be set to a database user with SYSDBA system privileges. You can use the default user SYS or a user that has been granted the SYSDBA privilege.

dbaPassword.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only.

Password for the Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instance administrator.

dbNetwork.description: Path to the network through which the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance accesses the database.

shape.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only.

Desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). Valid weblogic shapes include:

  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory

Valid otd shapes include:

  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory

See About Machine Images and Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service for more information about shapes. See About Custom Capacity Units and Advanced Configuration for Oracle SOA Cloud Service-Coherence Instances in Using Oracle SOA Cloud Service for guidelines on defining properties for a custom capacity unit.

VMsPublicKey.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only.

Name of the compute SSH key object referring to the public key. You generate an SSH public-private key pair using a standard SSH key generation tool.

If not specified for the load balancer, this value defaults to the VMsPublicKeyName object provided for the WebLogic Server.

Note: You must specify exactly one of the following attributes: VMsPublicKey or VMsPublicKeyName for both WebLogic Server and the load balancer.

type.description:
Component type to which the set of parameters applies. Valid values include:
  • weblogic - Oracle WebLogic Server
  • otd - Oracle Traffic Director (load balancer)
.

listenerPortsEnabled.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only; it is not valid for weblogic.

Flag that specifies whether the listener ports are enabled on the load balancer. This flag defaults to true.

loadBalancingPolicy.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only; it is not valid for weblogic.

Policy to use for routing requests to the load balancer. Valid policies include:

  • least_connection_count - Passes each new request to the Managed Server with the least number of connections. This policy is useful for smoothing distribution when Managed Servers get bogged down. Managed Servers with greater processing power to handle requests will receive more connections over time. This is the default.
  • least_response_time - Passes each new request to the Managed Server with the fastest response time. This policy is useful when Managed Servers are distributed across networks.
  • round_robin - Passes each new request to the next Managed Server in line, evenly distributing requests across all Managed Servers regardless of the number of connections or response time.

serviceName.description:
Name of Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance. The service name:
  • Must not exceed 50 characters.
  • Must start with a letter.
  • Must contain only letters, numbers, or hyphens.
  • Must not contain any other special characters.
  • Must be unique within the identity domain.

By default, the names of the domain and cluster in the service instance will be generated from the first eight characters of the service instance name (serviceName), using the following formats, respectively:

  • first8charsOfServiceInstanceName_domain
  • first8charsOfServiceInstanceName_cluster

level.description:
Service level. Valid values include:
  • PAAS- Production-level service. Supports Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance creation and monitoring; backup and restoration; patching; and scaling. This is the default.

topology.description:
Topology Name. Valid values include:
  • osb - Oracle Service Bus Topology.
  • soa - Service Oriented Architecture.
  • soaosb - Both OSB and SOA Topology.
  • b2b - Both B2B (Business to Business) and SOA Topology.
  • mft - MFT (Managed File Transfer) Topology.
  • insight - Oracle Business Insight (Business Activity Monitoring) Topology.

subscriptionType.description:
Billing unit. Valid values include:
  • MONTHLY - Pay one price for the full month irrespective of the number of hours used.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

provisionOTD.description: Flag that specifies whether to enable the load balancer. This value defaults to true when you configure more than one Managed Server for the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance. Otherwise, defaults to false.

cloudStorageContainer.description:
Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container used to provide storage for your service instance backups. Use the following format to specify the container name: <storageservicename>-<storageidentitydomain>/<containername>

Notes:

  • Do not use an Oracle Storage Cloud container that you use to back up Oracle SOA Cloud Service instances for any other purpose. For example, do not also use it to back up Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instances. Using the container for multiple purposes can result in billing errors.

publicNetwork.description: Path to the network from which the Oracle SOA Cloud Service REST API is accessed.

parameters.description:
Groups component-specific attributes in the following categories:
  • WebLogic Server ("type":"weblogic")
  • Oracle Traffic Director ("type":"otd")

service_id.description: Globally unique identifier for an Oracle SOA Service Instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle SOA Service Instance.

service_type.description:
The type of the service. Valid values include:
  • osb - Oracle Service Bus Topology.
  • soa - Service Oriented Architecture.
  • soaosb - Both OSB and SOA Topology.
  • b2b - Both B2B (Business to Business) and SOA Topology.
  • mft - MFT (Managed File Transfer) Topology.
  • insight - Oracle Business Insight (Business Activity Monitoring) Topology.

resource_count.description: Number of resources in the Stack Service Instance.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle SOA Service instance. Valid values include: Provisioning Not Started, Running, In Progress, Terminating, and Failed.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

creation_job_id.description: Job ID for the create job.

creation_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Service instance was created.

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Service instance was last modified.

created_by.description: Name of the user account used to create the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

service_uri.description: Resource URL for the Oracle SOA Service instance.

resources.description: The details of the individual resources in the SOA Service Instance.

service_id.description: Globally unique identifier for an Oracle SOA Service Instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle SOA Service Instance.

service_type.description:
The type of the service. Valid values include:
  • osb - Oracle Service Bus Topology.
  • soa - Service Oriented Architecture.
  • soaosb - Both OSB and SOA Topology.
  • b2b - Both B2B (Business to Business) and SOA Topology.
  • mft - MFT (Managed File Transfer) Topology.
  • insight - Oracle Business Insight (Business Activity Monitoring) Topology.

resource_count.description: Number of resources in the Stack Service Instance.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle SOA Service instance. Valid values include: Provisioning Not Started, Running, In Progress, Terminating, and Failed.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

creation_job_id.description: Job ID for the create job.

creation_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Service instance was created.

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Service instance was last modified.

created_by.description: Name of the user account used to create the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

service_uri.description: Resource URL for the Oracle SOA Service instance.

InstanceDelete-response.description: The response body contains information about the delete operation.

auto-update.description: Flag that specifies whether updates to the Oracle Cloud Tools are automatically applied to the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance during the maintenance window. The Oracle Cloud Tools are used to manage the lifecycle of your service instance.

compliance_status.description:
Status indicating whether the version of Oracle Cloud Tools is out of compliance. Oracle uses Oracle Cloud Tools to manage the lifecycle of your service instance. If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: Indicates a new version of Oracle Cloud Tools is available. Oracle strongly recommends that you apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle Cloud Tools update to avoid any disruption of service in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is not supported. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

compliance_status_desc.description:
Description that provides more details about the compliance status of the Oracle Cloud Tools, used to manage the lifecycle of your Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance. If the service instance is out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following descriptions, based on the status value:If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: A newer version of Oracle tools latestVersion is available. This update includes critical fixes to Oracle Cloud Tools. Oracle uses cloud tools to manage lifecycle of your service. Oracle strongly recommends that customers apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: This service is currently in a deprecated state because the Oracle tools version deprecatedVersion is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle tools update as this version may not be supported in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: This service is currently in an unsupported state because the Oracle tools version unsupportedVersion is obsolete. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

created_by.description: Name of the account used to create the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

creation_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance was created.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

error_status_desc.description:
Error status that describes the reason that the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance is in an erroneous state. The following provides an example of the description:

This service is currently in an erroneous state as the tools are in an inconsistent state. Reason - error details. Apply the latest tools patch to resume normal operations on this service.

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance was last modified.

service_name.description: Name of Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

service_url.description: Resource URL of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance at the time the delete operation was requested. Valid values include: Running, In Progress, Terminating, and Failed.

version.description: Oracle Fusion Middleware software version. Valid values include: 12cR3 and 11g.

wlsVersion.description: Oracle WebLogic Server software version. Valid values include: 12.1.3.0.4 and 10.3.6.0.9.

InstanceDelete-putrequest.description: The request body defines the details of the delete service instance request. Bold indicates a required value.

dbaName.description: Username for the Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instance administrator.

dbaPassword.description: Password for the Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service  administrator.

forceDelete.description: Flag that specifies whether you want to force the removal of the service instance even if the database instance cannot be reached to delete the database schemas. If set to true, you may need to delete the associated database schemas manually on the database instance if they are not deleted as part of the service instance delete operation. This value defaults to false.

skipBackupOnTerminate.description: Flag that specifies whether you want to skip backing up the service instance before deleting it. This value defaults to true.

serviceName.description:
Name of Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance. The service name:
  • Must not exceed 50 characters.
  • Must start with a letter.
  • Must contain only letters, numbers, or hyphens.
  • Must not contain any other special characters.
  • Must be unique within the identity domain.

By default, the names of the domain and cluster in the service instance will be generated from the first eight characters of the service instance name (serviceName), using the following formats, respectively:

  • first8charsOfServiceInstanceName_domain
  • first8charsOfServiceInstanceName_cluster

level.description:
Service level. Valid values include:
  • PAAS- Production-level service. Supports Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance creation and monitoring; backup and restoration; patching; and scaling. This is the default.

topology.description:
Topology Name. Valid values include:
  • osb - Oracle Service Bus Topology.
  • soa - Service Oriented Architecture.
  • soaosb - Both OSB and SOA Topology.
  • b2b - Both B2B (Business to Business) and SOA Topology.
  • mft - MFT (Managed File Transfer) Topology.
  • insight - Oracle Business Insight (Business Activity Monitoring) Topology.

subscriptionType.description:
Billing unit. Valid values include:
  • MONTHLY - Pay one price for the full month irrespective of the number of hours used.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

provisionOTD.description: Flag that specifies whether to enable the load balancer. This value defaults to true when you configure more than one Managed Server for the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance. Otherwise, defaults to false.

cloudStorageContainer.description:
Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container used to provide storage for your service instance backups. Use the following format to specify the container name: <storageservicename>-<storageidentitydomain>/<containername>

Notes:

  • An Oracle Storage Cloud Service container is not required when provisioning an Oracle SOA Cloud Service - Virtual Image instance. However, you may need a service container if you provision a standard-level Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instance for use with the Oracle SOA Cloud Service - Virtual Image instance.
  • Do not use an Oracle Storage Cloud container that you use to back up Oracle SOA Cloud Service instances for any other purpose. For example, do not also use it to back up Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service instances. Using the container for multiple purposes can result in billing errors.

publicNetwork.description: Path to the network from which the Oracle SOA Cloud Service REST API will be accessed. You can connect to an external network via the InfiniBand-to-10 GB Ethernet gateways using Ethernet over InfiniBand (EoIB).

parameters.description:
Groups component-specific attributes in the following categories:
  • WebLogic Server ("type":"weblogic")
  • Oracle Traffic Director ("type":"otd")

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days the incremental backups are retained.
Full backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is available.
If set to null, backups are retained indefinitely or until you manually delete them.

fullBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next full backup.
By default, full backups are initiated weekly starting 12 hours after a service instance was created, rounded to the nearest five-minute interval.

incrementalBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next incremental backup.
By default, incremental backups are initiated every day except the day of a full backup at the same time that full backups are initiated.
Units are the same as for 'fullBackupSchedule'.

lastBackupDate.description:
Date and time that the last backup completed.
Note: If there have been no backups, this attribute is omitted.

nextFullBackupDate.description: Scheduled date and time for next full backup.

nextIncrementalBackupDate.description: Scheduled date and time for next incremental backup.

cloudStorageContainer.description: Oracle Cloud Storage Service container name.

totalCloudStorageContainerUsed.description: Total amount, in MBs, of Cloud Storage Container space that is currently in use.

totalBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total amount, in MBs, of the backup volume that is currently in use.

percentBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total percent of the backup volume that is currently in use.

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days the incremental backups are retained.
Full backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is available.
If set to null, backups are retained indefinitely or until you manually delete them.

fullBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next full backup.
By default, full backups are initiated weekly starting 12 hours after a service instance was created, rounded to the nearest five-minute interval.

incrementalBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next incremental backup.
By default, incremental backups are initiated every day except the day of a full backup at the same time that full backups are initiated.
Units are the same as for 'fullBackupSchedule'.

cloudStorageContainer.description: Oracle Cloud Storage Service container name.

expirationDate.description:
Date and time that the backup will be deleted automatically from storage. For full backups, you can set this value to null (no quotes) to specify no expiration date.
By default, backups are retained for the default retention period defined in the backup configuration;

notes.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the backup.

jobId.description: Job ID for the backup operation.

backupStartDate.description: Date and time that the backup started.

backupCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the backup completed. This attribute is not valid for backups that are in progress.

expirationDate.description: Date and time that the backup will be deleted automatically from storage. If set to null, the backup is retained indefinitely or until you manually delete it.

initiatedBy.description: User account that initiated this operation.

full.description: Flag that specifies whether this is a full (true) or incremental (false) backup. Full backups contain all of the instance files, including runtime artifacts and files that change infrequently or do not change. Incremental backups contain only the runtime artifacts of each managed VM in the instance.

local.description: Flag that specifies whether the backup is to be downloaded and stored locally in block storage on the Administration Server (true), or archived and stored remotely on the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container (false).

size.description: Size of the backup, in MBs. For example: 1011.4MB (backup complete) or Unknown (backup in-progress).

dbTag.description:
RMAN tag that identifies the Oracle Cloud Database Service database files. You can use this tag if you need to restore the database. For more information about restoring the database, see Restoring from a Specific Backup in Using Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service.

Note: This attribute is included only if the database was included in the backup.

status.description: Status of the backup. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, Deleted, Backup In Progress, Upload In Progress, Download In Progress, Restore In Progress, or Delete In Progress.

ViewTheBackupResponse.title: ViewTheBackupResponse.
ViewTheBackupResponse.description: The response body contains information about the backup

backupStartDate.title: BackupStartDate schema.
backupStartDate.description: Date and time that the backup started.

backupCompleteDate.title: BackupCompleteDate schema.
backupCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the backup completed.

expirationDate.title: ExpirationDate schema.
expirationDate.description: Date and time that the backup will be deleted automatically from storage. If set to null, the backup is retained indefinitely or until you manually delete it.

initiatedBy.title: InitiatedBy schema.
initiatedBy.description: User account that initiated this operation.

full.title: Full schema.
full.description:
Boolean flag that specifies whether this is a full (true) or incremental (false) backup.
Full backups contain all of the service instance files, including runtime artifacts and files that change infrequently or do not change.
Incremental backups contain only the runtime artifacts of each managed VM in the service instance.

local.title: Local schema.
local.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether the backup is stored locally, on disk (true), or on Oracle Storage Cloud Service (false).

size.title: Size schema.
size.description:
Size of the backup, in MBs. For example:
  • '1011.4MB' (if backup is complete)
  • 'Unknown' (if backup is in progress)

dbTag.title: DbTag schema.
dbTag.description:
This attribute is included only if the database was included in the backup.
ID for the Oracle Cloud Database Service database files. You can use this ID if you need to restore the database. For more information about restoring the Oracle Cloud Database Service, see Restoring from a Specific Backup in Using Oracle Database Cloud - Database as a Service.

forceScaleInRequiredForRestore.title: forceScaleInRequiredForRestore
forceScaleInRequiredForRestore.description:
Message that indicates the current Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance has Managed Servers configured that are not included in this backup. This value is set to the following error message that provides more information:
JAAS-BR-105: Unable to restore configuration data for managed servers that are not part of the backup. The affected managedsServers are: [managedserver_x, managedserver_y]. Scale in the instance to remove these managed servers' nodes and then try to restore the instance again.
Before you restore the Oracle SOA Cloud Server instance using this backup, perform one of the following steps:
Scale in the service instance to remove the Managed Servers noted in the error message above.
To automatically scale in the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance, set the 'forceScaleIn' attribute to true when restoring using this backup, as described in Restore a Service Instance

items.title: 1 schema.
items.description: Job ID for the backup operation.

operation.title: Operation schema.
operation.description: Type of operation being executed that was executed. For example, backup, delete, download, upload, an d so on.

jobId.title: JobId schema.
jobId.description: Job ID for the backup operation.

status.title: Status schema.
status.description:
Status of the backup. Valid values include:
  • 'Completed'
  • 'Failed'
  • 'Deleted'
  • 'Backup In Progress'
  • 'Upload In Progress'
  • 'Download In Progress'
  • 'Delete In Progress'

startDate.title: StartDate schema.
startDate.description: Date and time the operation started.

completeDate.title: CompleteDate schema.
completeDate.description: Date and time the operation completed.

statusDetails.title: StatusDetails schema.
statusDetails.description: History of system messages. Each message is separated by an ellipses.

RestoreBackupPayload.description: The request body defines the details of the restoration request. Bold indicates a required value.

forceScaleIn.description:
Flag that specifies whether to automatically scale in the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance if there are Managed Servers configured that are not included in the backup being restored. This value defaults to false, indicating that the service instance should not be scaled in automatically.

If this flag is set to false and the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance has Managed Servers configured that are not included in the backup being restored, the operation fails and the following error message is returned:

JAAS-BR-105: Unable to restore configuration data for managed servers that are not part of the backup. The affected managedsServers are: [managedserver_x, managedserver_y]. Scale in the service instance to remove these managed servers' nodes and then try to restore the service instance again.

Note: This flag is valid only when restoring configuration data (restoreConfig is set to true).

notes.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the restoration operation.

pauseOTD.description:
Flag that specifies whether to pause the load balancer during the restoration process. This value defaults to false.

If set to true, the load balancer is paused and stops forwarding requests to the Managed Servers in the service instance during the restoration process, and responds with an HTTP 503 status code to client requests. After the restoration process completes, the load balancer is restarted.

If pause or restart of the load balancer fails, for example, because the load balancer Administration Server is not available, the restoration process proceeds. The restoration process will fail, however, if the load balancer health check fails.

You should not rely on this feature if any manual tasks are required to be performed once the restoration completes. For more information, see Returning an Oracle SOA Cloud Service Instance to Service After Restoration from a Backup in Using Oracle SOA Cloud Service.

Note: This flag is valid only if the load balancer is enabled.

operationName.description: Operation performed. This value is set to: restore-backup.

jobId.description: Job ID for the restoration operation.

restoreInProgress.description: Groups all restoration operations that are in progress.

jobId.description: Job ID for the restore operation.

backupDate.description: Date and time of the backup.

recoveryStartDate.description: Date and time that the restoration operation started.

recoveryCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the restoration operation completed.

statusDetails.description: History of system messages. Each message is separated by an ellipses

staticDataIncluded.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether static binary files are included (true) in the restoration operation.

configDataIncluded.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether configuration data was restored (true).

otdIncluded.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether the load balancer was restored (true).

notes.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the backup.

status.description:
Status of the restoration operation. Valid values include:
  • 'Completed'
  • 'Failed'
  • 'Restore In Progress'

ArchiveOrDownloadBackupPayload.description: The request body defines the details of the archive or download backup request. Bold indicates a required value.

local.description: Flag that specifies whether the backup is to be downloaded and stored locally in block storage on the Administration Server (true), or archived and stored remotely on the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container (false).

ArchiveOrDownloadBackupResponse.description: The response body contains information about the archive or download backup operation.

jobId.description: Job ID for the archive or download backup operation.

operationName.description: Name of operation performed. Set to: move-backup

target_uri.description: URI of the archive or download backup resource.

servers.description: Groups all servers defined for the service instance.

serverInProgress.description: Groups all servers that are in the process of being created, with the status of In Progress.

clusterName.description: Name of the cluster to which the Managed Server belongs.

creationDate.description: Date and time the server was created.

isAdmin.description: Flag that specifies whether this Managed Server is also the Administration Server.

jobId.description: Job ID for the scale operation.

nodeType.description: Type of node. For example, WLS or DG.

reservedIp.description: IP address that is allocated from the IP address pool associated with the Managed Server. This attribute is valid only for the Administration Server or load balancer.

shape.description: Compute shape of the server. See About Machine Images and Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service.

status.description: Status of the operation. For example, Ready.

storageAllocated.description: Amount of allocated storage in MBs.

affectedServer.description: Name of the Managed Server or load balancer impacted by the operation.

endDate.description: Date and time the operation completed. If the operation is still in progress or if it failed, this field is omitted.

hostName.description: Host name of the Managed Server or load balancer.

id.description: ID of the operation. You can use the operation ID to check its status.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the scaling operation is in progress.

jobId.description:
Job ID for the scaling operation. You can use the job ID to check its status.

Note:This value may be set to No Job Submitted temporarily, just prior to being submitted for processing.

operationType.description: Type of operation. For example: SCALE_IN, SCALE_OUT, START_VM, STOP_VM, START_SERVICE, STOP_SERVICE, and so on.

serviceId.description: ID of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

startDate.description: Date and time the operation started.

status.description: Status of the operation. Example status messages include: Preparing for scaling, Scaling completed, Verifying the scaled WebLogic Server, Scaling operation failed, SUCCEED, and FAILED.

actLog.description: Groups the activities defined in the log.

endDate.description: Date and time the operation ended.

hostName.description: Host name of the server or load balancer.

identityId.description: Name of the identity domain for the Oracle SOA Cloud Service account.

jobId.description:
Job ID for the operation.

Note: This value may be set to No Job Submitted temporarily, just prior to being submitted for processing.

serverName.description: Name of the server or load balancer.

serverType.description: Type of server, such as WLS or OTD.

serviceId.description: ID of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle SOA Cloud Service instance.

startDate.description: Date and time the operation started.

status.description: Final status of the operation. Example status messages include: NEW, RUNNING, SUCCEED, and FAILED.

additionalStorage.description: Amount of gigabytes (GBs) that you want to increase block storage. You can specify the storage volume using the scalingVolume attribute. If no storage volume is specified, a new storage volume is created.

scalingVolume.description:
Storage volume to which you want to add block storage. This attribute is valid only if you specify the additionalStorage attribute in your request. If not specified, a new storage volume is created.

Valid values include:

  • backup - Adds block storage to the backup storage volume. This is valid when scaling the Administration Server node only.
  • domains - Adds block storage to the domain home storage volume.
  • middleware - Adds block storage to the Oracle Fusion Middleware home storage volume.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape.

This attribute is required. If you do not want to change the compute shape, set this value to match the current compute shape.

Valid weblogic shapes include:

  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory

Valid otd shapes include:

  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory

See About Machine Images and Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service (for PaaS) for more information about shapes.

scale-up-response.description: The response body contains information about the scale operation.

details.description: Groups the details of the scale operation.

status.description: Status of the operation. When first initiated, the status is set to New. The status may transition to one of the following values: Completed and Cannot Complete.

jobId.description: Job ID for the scale operation.

message.description: System message that describes the operation. For example: scaleup.job.submitted
